title: Photoshoot Workflow: Estrella Damm Sailing Team with Peter Hurley
summary: Photographer Peter Hurley demonstrates his workflow for photographing the Estrella Damm sailing team on an IMOCA 60 yacht in New York Harbor, covering gear selection, directing subjects, and handling dynamic lighting conditions.

steps.action: Assess the location and subject matter (IMOCA 60 Yacht) prior to the shoot.
Select specific camera gear for high resolution and wide angles.
Direct the subjects into position to compose the shot against the background.
Shoot from a chase boat to capture the full scale of the yacht against the city skyline.
Capture a high volume of frames (approx. 700) to ensure usable shots amidst movement.
Get close to the action to document the physical exertion of the crew.
Evaluate lighting conditions, noting challenges like strong backlighting.

key_takeaways: Utilize a wide-angle lens (e.g., 28mm) to capture both the subjects and the environment when space is limited or the subject is large.
Expect to shoot a significantly higher volume of frames than usual when working on a moving platform like a boat.
Active direction of subjects is crucial for getting clean shots in a chaotic environment.
Be adaptable to harsh lighting conditions, such as backlighting, which are common in outdoor marine photography.
